meanings.sent1: In our community garden, the cocultivations of vegetables and flowers create a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often practice cocultivations of different crops to improve soil health.
meanings.sent3: The cocultivations of pumpkins and sunflowers seemed like a gardening dance party.
meanings.sent4: The cocultivations of ideas and creativity in the classroom can lead to amazing projects.
meanings.sent5: Her cocultivations of kindness and generosity made her a beloved member of the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The process of growing two or more organisms together in the same environment.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the cocultivations of bacteria and fungi to understand their interactions.
meanings.sent2: Aquaponics is a method that involves the cocultivations of fish and plants in a closed system.
meanings.sent3: The cocultivations of ants and bees in the garden created quite a buzz among the insects.
meanings.sent4: The cocultivations of talent and hard work can lead to great success in any field.
meanings.sent5: The cocultivations of tradition and innovation are essential for progress in society.
